How can I modify the given PHP code to classify the dominant emotion in a given sentence using R programming language? Below is a sample R code that uses the Indico API to classify emotions in text. Fill in the missing elements to complete the code and classify the dominant emotion in the given sentence "The thought of losing my best friend is heart-wrenching."
library(httr)
library(jsonlite)
text <- "The thought of losing my best friend is heart-wrenching"
url <- "https://api.indico.io/emotion"
key <- "_______" # Please fill in your Indico API key
response <- POST(url,
                 add_headers("Content-Type" = "application/json"),
                 body = toJSON(list(api_key = key, data = text)))
results <- content(response, as = "text")
results <- fromJSON(results)
dominant_emotion <- _______ # Fill in the missing code to identify the dominant emotion
cat("The dominant emotion in the sentence is: ", dominant_emotion, "\n")

To complete the R code for classifying the dominant emotion using the Indico API, you need to fill in your API key and identify the emotion with the highest probability from the results. Here's how you can modify the code:

```r
library(httr)
library(jsonlite)

text <- "The thought of losing my best friend is heart-wrenching"
url <- "https://api.indico.io/emotion"
key <- "YOUR_INDICO_API_KEY" # Please fill in your Indico API key

response <- POST(url,
                 add_headers("Content-Type" = "application/json"),
                 body = toJSON(list(api_key = key, data = text)))

results <- content(response, as = "text")
results <- fromJSON(results)

# Find the dominant emotion by identifying the emotion with the highest score
dominant_emotion <- names(which.max(results$results))

cat("The dominant emotion in the sentence is: ", dominant_emotion, "\n")
```

Make sure to replace `"YOUR_INDICO_API_KEY"` with your actual Indico API key. The code identifies the dominant emotion by finding the emotion with the highest score from the API response.
